data.title: Pranjal Chalise - Peer Career Advisor at Amherst College | The Org
data.snippet:
# Pranjal Chalise

### Peer Career Advisor

Pranjal Chalise is a Software Engineer at Microsoft since June 2025, specializing in CoreAI. Concurrently, Pranjal serves as a Peer Career Advisor and a Peer Tutor in both the Math and Computer Science Departments at Amherst College, providing support for students in academic and professional development. Pranjal's prior experience includes working as an AI/ML Fellow and Software Engineer at Microsoft in 2024, and holding various roles at Amherst College such as Math & Stats Student Steering Committee Fellow and IT Specialist. Additionally, Pranjal contributed as a Research Assistant and Research Scholar at Incubate Nepal and is pursuing a Bachelor of Arts in Computer Science and Mathematics at Amherst College, expected to graduate in May 2026. [...] Log inSign up

data.title: Pranjal Chalise: An Enthusiastic Technopreneur! - Glocal Teen Hero
data.snippet:
Glocal Teen Hero
Glocal Teen Hero
Glocal Teen Hero
Glocal Teen Hero
Glocal Teen Hero
Glocal Teen Hero

¬© 2022, Glocal Pvt. Ltd.

Privacy & Cookie Policy | Terms of Service

Mr.Pranjal Chalise is a 19 years old Enthusiastic Technopreneur & Independent Researcher from Kathmandu. He is a high school graduate who is enthralled by the idea of Computer Science‚Äôs limitless transdisciplinary possibilities. His work-platform and experience projects have unlocked the potential of Computer Science to address societal obstacles and communal difficulties on a micro to macro scale. [...] Apart from that; He is the founder & Project Mentor of Students Research Council Nepal (SRCN), (an organization that provides the platform of research and project-based education to high-school enthusiasts and provides paper-writing and app development training). He finished the initial round of research and launched Gyan-E, Nepal‚Äôs first-ever discussion forum. They have guided 7 brilliant high schoolers under his mentorship. In the International Journal, SRCN has successfully published 4 research papers.

As a Computer Science Mentor, he taught coding and mobile app development to high school students. His work has been recognized by the Nepal Academy of Science and Technology for their efforts to introduce the concept of research and instill it in young students. [...] Besides this; He is also working in BloomED (Bloom School Nepal), a non-profit educational and academic resource platform. He has been working as a content creation intern and contributed in drafting the educational resources that will be distributed to many students in disadvantage.

In the future, he envisions himself honing and upgrading talents, investing heavily in intensive training to obtain more advanced technology skills so that he may best serve the community.

##### Pranjal Chalise has been selected as a ‚ÄúGlocal‚Äôs 20under20 of 2021 Batch‚Äù as an early change-maker throughout the nation. Glocal‚Äôs 20 under 20 is an umbrella title for 20 early change-makers, who are teenagers from diverse fields, stepping out to create an impact in the society.

data.title: Team Tumornators | An Incubate Nepal Project
data.snippet:
2021

## Aayusha Dhungana

Team Samsad(2021)

‚ÄúPolitics and Social science, something that I was not really fond of. But to my own surprise, I was paired up with my team mates to build a website featuring parliament system of Nepal. Entering the whole new world of website building and politics surely frightened me, but the continuous support from the mentor and my wonderful team made this whole journey very smooth and informative. Incubate Nepal, helped me break my comforting cocoon and stand out in the crowd to learn, take challenges and share tons of memories with the whole team.‚Äù

2021

## Pranjal Chalise

Team Kisan, Team Drishti(2020) [...] 2021

## Pranjal Chalise

Team Kisan, Team Drishti(2020)

‚ÄúA surreal utopia where friends turned into F.R.I.E.N.D.S, and fanatics into professionals. Contributing to two different teams- ‚ÄòTeam Kisan' and ‚ÄòTeam Drishti' was overwhelming but the realization that, through my projects, I could deliver ripple effects in the community- be it in the lives of farmers or differently-abled people, was certainly more promising. A bunch of high-school pass-outs coming together to create impacts on society sounds a bit fancy. At Incubate Nepal you'll witness countless such fancy sugarcoats turning into real-life realities.‚Äù

2020

## Anupa Khanal

Team Brahmanda(2020) [...] ‚ÄúIncubate Nepal is a once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to cherish. It has enabled me to learn my first real research project on Nepal's financial status and my personal growth. One of the most valuable impressions Incubate Nepal has left on me is that one should not strive for perfection; instead, being honest, authentic, and dedicated is sufficient. Learning hard skills, soft skills, and diversity have all had a significant impact on my way of seeing things. Everyone in the Incubate Nepal Family is so welcoming and full of life experiences. My mentor, Anamika didi, and my teammates have been so supportive that they have always made time to sit down and teach me in a variety of ways, whether in research or in life. I will be eternally thankful to this family for providing me with a

data.title: Student Staff - Loeb Center for Career Exploration and Planning
data.snippet:
planning activities, and sharing meals with peers. As a transfer student who has benefited from mentorship, she values supporting others in their career journeys which is one of the main reasons she became a PCA. [...] At Amherst, I‚Äôm involved in research with the Chemistry department on energy transfer using quantum dots for different applications. Since freshman year, I‚Äôve been involved in research with the Spanish/LLAS department on community filmmaking in Latin America. On campus I‚Äôm a member of La Causa, La Fe, and Questbridge. Last semester, I attended the American Educational Research Association‚Äôs international conference in Philadelphia. This summer I had the pleasure of doing a research internship at UPenn in the Mechanical/Chemical Engineering department.

In my free time, I enjoy spending time in nature, baking, watching Netflix, and getting boba with friends. [...] I am a member of the Amherst Women‚Äôs Cross Country and Track and Field team. When I am not running, you can often find me in the music building or the science center, as I am a member of the Glee Club and Concert Choir while co-leading the Mammoth MakerLab Club. For the past two years, I have been a member of the Education Professions group and enjoy having meaningful discussions and workshops with my peers. In my free time, I also love hiking, biking, reading, and spending time with my family and friends.
